[center]The topic of Chapter 1 is possibility.
If the event described below is [b]possible[/b] (including events that are bound to happen)
[b]according to your knowledge[/b],
then left click the green box to answer "P" (Possible);
otherwise, right click to answer "NP" (Not Possible).[/center]
1. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head faces up (it's still a standard coin).
2. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head or tail faces up (it's still a standard coin).
3. A standard coin is tossed. After it lands, its head and tail face up simultaneously (it's still a standard coin).

You will receive a penalty when you submit a wrong answer,\nwhich prevents you from answering this problem for a while.\nSubmitting a wrong answer multiple times makes the penalty for this problem longer.
1. The worm that you find in restaurant food was dropped out of your own mouth.
2. The one that matches the fingerprint on the murder weapon is not the murderer.
3. You return home, and then find a stranger in your bathroom.
Hover over a piece of yellow text and don't move your cursor\nfor extra clarifications for the text.
1. Someone is holding a red apple that is not red.
2. Someone has experienced their first kiss without ever touching anyone.
3. A [color=yellow][hint=extremely thin]line segment[/hint][/color] is added inside a convex pentagon, which divides the pentagon into two triangles.
4. A [color=yellow][hint=extremely thin]line segment[/hint][/color] is added inside a concave pentagon, which divides the pentagon into two triangles.
1. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 squirrels, and a total of 4 pieces of wood.
2. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 pieces of wood, and a total of 4 balls.
3. A total of 5 objects are in a bag. Among the 5 objects, there are a total of 3 balls, and a total of 4 marbles.
1. An event that someone else claimed to have happened didn't actually happen.
2. An event that a book claimed to have happened didn't actually happen.
3. The scene depicted in an image didn't actually happen.
1. Dinosaurs did not exist.
2. World War I was fought against aliens.
3. The so-called "Newton's laws of motion" were discovered by Galileo Galilei.
2. You have never met your biological mother.
3. The day before yesterday, a nuclear war erupted on earth, with a death toll of over a hundred million people.
1. Your biological father's [color=yellow][hint=could be more than one date due to divorce]wedding date(s)[/hint][/color] and your biological mother's wedding date(s) do not share a same date.
1. When you were born, you saw a blue pigeon flying by.
2. Last month, you saw a blue pigeon flying by.
3. Last time you slept, you dreamed of a blue pigeon flying by.
[center]More specifically, the rule for answering "P" is:\n[b]When you are reading the problem[/b],\nthe event described below is possible according to your knowledge.[/center]
1. I just gave you a punch within the past 10 minutes.
2. Before you entered this level this time, the title of this level shown in the map was not "Memory 2". It was your name and your ID number instead.
3. This page does not contain a single word.
1. When you try to recall a perception that you experienced in the past, you couldn't recall the same perception.
2. Your current perception does not exist.
1. You once went to a toilet to poop and then walked away and forgot to wipe.
2. The time dimension does not exist.
1. A cloud of matter is floating in space. It has flashed a hundred million times of green light consecutively. However, for the next time, it will flash red light.
1. [color=yellow][hint=as known as F=ma, a law that describes the motion of objects]Newton's Second Law of Motion[/hint][/color] does not hold true for some situations.
2. A substance appears out of nowhere.
3. There is a thing that looks the same as an opaque solid cube, but when an object moves into it, the object clips through it, and neither receives resistance from the other.
1. After your body dies, you will continue to perceive indefinitely.
2. All the people in the world other than you [color=yellow][hint=like you are playing a single-player game]do not have perception[/hint][/color] all along.

1. Among the Essenceology problems that I released or will release, one or more of the [color=yellow][hint=the answer against which your submitted answer is compared by the program]reference answers[/hint][/color] that I set are wrong.

A runaway train is heading towards a switch track. Each of the two leading tracks has some people tied to it. Beside you is a level that controls the switch. If you do nothing, the train will run over a total of  5  people. If you pull the level, the train will run over only  1  people. You should...
Do nothing
Pull the level
You are quarrelling with another person. If you punch him, you will experience a pleasure of value 5, and he will experience a pain of value 10. You should...
You are quarrelling with another person. If you punch him, you will experience a pleasure of value 50, and he will experience a pain of value 10. You should...
In front of you is a red button. If you press it, you have a 60% chance to experience a pleasure with a  value of 5, and another 40% chance to experience a pain with a value of 10. You should...
Press the button

There is a stack of three poker cards with values of 5, 7, and 9 respectively. After a period of time, someone will randomly draw one card from this stack, and you will experience a pleasure equal to the value of the drawn card. Now you should... remove the card with a value of 5 from the stack, do nothing, or add a card with a value of 3 to the stack
Remove the card with a value of 5 from the stack
Add a card with a value of 3 to the stack
